abac_mongo_cli.abac module

Documentação das funções e utilitários de ABAC.

Helper module to initialize Py-ABAC PDP, apply migrations, auto-load all policies and configure py-abac logging.

abac_mongo_cli.abac.build_request(subject_id, subject_attrs, resource_id, resource_attrs, action_id, action_attrs, context)

Create a Request object encapsulating subject, resource, action, and context for ABAC evaluation.

Parameters:

  • subject_id (str) – Unique identifier of the subject (e.g., user ID or ‘admin’).

  • subject_attrs (dict) – Dictionary of subject attributes (e.g., role, isChief, userIP).

  • resource_id (str) – Identifier of the resource (e.g., collection name or document ID).

  • resource_attrs (dict) – Dictionary of resource attributes (e.g., employee_id, type).

  • action_id (str) – Identifier of the action to perform (e.g., “read”, “create”).

  • action_attrs (dict) – Dictionary of action attributes (e.g., method name).

  • context (dict) – Dictionary of contextual attributes (e.g., ip, weekday, hour).

Returns:

A Py-ABAC Request object ready for policy evaluation.

Return type:

AccessRequest

abac_mongo_cli.abac.configure_abac_logging(log_file='abac.log')

Configure the logging system so that all Py-ABAC events at DEBUG level and above are written to the specified file.

This will: 1. Remove any existing handlers on the root logger. 2. Set up a FileHandler via basicConfig to capture all messages at DEBUG level and above. 3. Explicitly set the “py_abac” and “py_abac.pdp” loggers to DEBUG.

Parameters:

log_file (str) – Path to the file where log entries will be appended.

abac_mongo_cli.abac.delete_policy(client, policy_uid)

Deletes a policy from MongoStorage.

Parameters:

  • storage (MongoStorage) – The MongoStorage instance to which policies will be added.

  • policy_uid (str) – Policy uid

abac_mongo_cli.abac.get_policies(client)

Prints all access control policies from Mongo storage in pages of 3, clearing the terminal between pages. Press Enter to continue.

Parameters:

client (MongoClient) – A pymongo.MongoClient connected to the MongoDB server.

abac_mongo_cli.abac.initialize_pdp(client, db_name='Northwind', policies_dir='policies')

Set up the Mongo-backed storage for ABAC policies, apply migrations, load all JSON policies from the given directory, configure logging, and return a configured PDP instance.

Parameters:

  • client (MongoClient) – A pymongo.MongoClient connected to the MongoDB server.

  • db_name (str) – Name of the database where ABAC policies are stored.

  • policies_dir (str) – Path to the directory containing policy JSON files.

Returns:

An initialized Policy Decision Point (PDP) ready for evaluation.

Return type:

PDP

abac_mongo_cli.abac.load_policies(storage, policies_dir='policies')

Load all JSON policy files from the specified directory into the MongoStorage.

Parameters:

  • storage (MongoStorage) – The MongoStorage instance to which policies will be added.

  • policies_dir (str) – Path to the directory containing policy JSON files.

abac_mongo_cli.abac.update_policy(client, policy_name, policies_dir='policies')

Update the ABAC policy with the given name by reloading its JSON file.

Parameters:

  • client (MongoClient) – A pymongo.MongoClient connected to the MongoDB server.

  • policy_name (_str) – Filename (without .json) of the policy to update.

  • policies_dir (str) – Path to the directory containing policy JSON files.

abac_mongo_cli.main module

Documentação do entry-point e loop interativo.

Mongo ABAC CLI - Login by entering your employee ID (or ‘admin’ for the admin role) - Connects to MongoDB with hard-coded credentials (adminLocal/adminLocal) - Enforce Py-ABAC policies stored in MongoDB - Menu-driven CRUD operations - Logs all login events and user actions to cli.log - Uses prompt_toolkit.prompt() to supports the arrow clicks

abac_mongo_cli.main.connection(subject_id)

Connects to MongoDB, and returns the connection.

Parameters:

subject_id (str) – User id

Returns:

The connection

Return type:

MongoClient

abac_mongo_cli.main.get_clearance(action)

Prompt for a clearance level and return it. If action is True, returns an int (1–3); otherwise returns a list from 1 up to the entered level.

Parameters:

action (bool) – True to get a single action clearance, False for a user clearance list.

Returns:

An int (if action) or list of ints (if not).

Return type:

int or list[int]

The employee ID (from resource arguments) to use in the action.

str

abac_mongo_cli.main.perform_request(client, collection, pymongo_op, subject_id, payload)

Execute the specified MongoDB operation, log it, and display the results.

Parameters:

  • client (MongoClient) – The MongoClient instance connected to the database.

  • collection (str) – Name of the collection to operate on.

  • pymongo_op (str) – The operation to perform (“find”, “insert_one”, “update_many”, “delete_many”).

  • subject_id (str) – Identifier of the user performing the operation.

  • payload (dict) – The filter or document data for the operation.

Returns:

True if the operation succeeded, False on error.

Return type:

bool

abac_mongo_cli.main.print_banner()

Print the ASCII art banner to the console at startup.

abac_mongo_cli.main.shell()

Start and run the interactive ABAC CLI shell.

This function drives the full CLI workflow:

  1. Prompts for user login via login_menu().

  2. Connects to MongoDB using connection().

  3. Initializes the Py-ABAC PDP (loads policies, configures logging) with initialize_pdp().

  4. Enters a menu-driven loop via main_menu(), evaluates each request against the PDP, and dispatches CRUD or admin operations.
